https://gs1.org/voc/GeoCoordinates.title: Geographic Coordinates
https://gs1.org/voc/GeoCoordinates.description: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

https://gs1.org/voc/latitude.title: Latitude
https://gs1.org/voc/latitude.description: Angular distance North or South from the earth's equator measured through 90 degrees.

https://gs1.org/voc/longitude.title: Longitude
https://gs1.org/voc/longitude.description: The arc or portion of the earth's equator intersected between the meridian of a given place and the prime meridian and expressed in degrees.

schema.title: Geographic Coordinates
schema.description: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Angular distance North or South from the earth's equator measured through 90 degrees.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The arc or portion of the earth's equator intersected between the meridian of a given place and the prime meridian and expressed in degrees.

http://semanticscience.org/resource/Mate.title: Material
http://semanticscience.org/resource/Mate.description: A material entity is a physical entity that is spatially extended, exists as a whole at any point in time and has mass.

http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessProperty.title: Strength
http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessProperty.description: Materials property representing the material's resistance to deformation under an applied compressive load from a test fixture of known tip geometry.

http://nanomine.org/ns/FractureToughness.title: Toughness
http://nanomine.org/ns/FractureToughness.description: Materials property representing the material's resistance to deformation under an applied compressive load from a test fixture of known tip geometry.

schema.title: Material
schema.description: A material entity is a physical entity that is spatially extended, exists as a whole at any point in time and has mass.

hardness.title: Hardness
hardness.description: Materials property representing the material's resistance to deformation under an applied compressive load from a test fixture of known tip geometry.

strength.title: Strength
strength.description: Materials property representing the material's resistance to deformation under an applied compressive load from a test fixture of known tip geometry.

toughness.title: Toughness
toughness.description: Materials property representing the material's resistance to deformation under an applied compressive load from a test fixture of known tip geometry.

http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessProperty.title: Material Hardness
http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessProperty.description: Materials property representing the material's resistance to deformation under an applied compressive load from a test fixture of known tip geometry.

http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessTestStand.title: Standard
http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessTestStand.description: A materials testing standard, created by a standards body such as ASTM, defining test parameters such as pre-load, load, and tip geometry of the testing apparatus.

http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessScale.title: Scale
http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessScale.description: A standard numerical scale associated with a particular hardness test tip geometry.

http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessValue.title: Value
http://nanomine.org/ns/HardnessValue.description: The numerical value of hardness output by the testing apparatus, given a particular hardness scale as input.

schema.title: Material Hardness
schema.description: Materials property representing the material's resistance to deformation under an applied compressive load from a test fixture of known tip geometry.

standard.title: Standard
standard.description: A materials testing standard, created by a standards body such as ASTM, defining test parameters such as pre-load, load, and tip geometry of the testing apparatus.

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: A standard numerical scale associated with a particular hardness test tip geometry.

value.title: Value
value.description: The numerical value of hardness output by the testing apparatus, given a particular hardness scale as input.

https://gs1.org/voc/Place.title: Place
https://gs1.org/voc/Place.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical location.

https://gs1.org/voc/globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://gs1.org/voc/globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number (GLN) is the GS1 Identification Key used to identify physical locations or parties. The key comprises a GS1 Company Prefix, Location Reference and Check Digit. For more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

https://gs1.org/voc/GeoCoordinates.title: Geographic Coordinates
https://gs1.org/voc/GeoCoordinates.description: Links to information about geocoordinates for a place.

https://gs1.org/voc/PostalAddress.title: Postal Address
https://gs1.org/voc/PostalAddress.description: The postal address for an organization or place.

schema.title: Place
schema.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical location.

globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number (GLN) is the GS1 Identification Key used to identify physical locations or parties. The key comprises a GS1 Company Prefix, Location Reference and Check Digit. For more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

geo.title: Geographic Coordinates
geo.description: Links to information about geocoordinates for a place.

address.title: Postal Address
address.description: The postal address for an organization or place.

https://gs1.org/voc/PostalAddress.title: Postal Address
https://gs1.org/voc/PostalAddress.description: The location at which a particular organization or person may be found or reached.

https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.title: Organization Name
https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.description: The name of the organization expressed in text.

https://gs1.org/voc/streetAddress.title: Street Address
https://gs1.org/voc/streetAddress.description: The street address expressed as free form text. The street address is printed on paper as the first lines below the name. For example, the name of the street and the number in the street or the name of a building.

https://gs1.org/voc/addressLocality.title: Address Locality
https://gs1.org/voc/addressLocality.description: Text specifying the name of the locality, for example a city.

https://gs1.org/voc/addressRegion.title: Address Region
https://gs1.org/voc/addressRegion.description: Text specifying a province or state in abbreviated format for example NJ.

https://gs1.org/voc/addressCountry.title: Address Country
https://gs1.org/voc/addressCountry.description: Code specifying the country (and country subdivision) for the address using ISO 3166-1.

https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.title: Cross Street
https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.description: A street intersecting a main street (usually at right angles) and continuing on both sides of it.

https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.title: County Code
https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.description: A code that identifies a county. A county is a territorial division in some countries, forming the chief unit of local administration. In the US, a county is a political and administrative division of a state.

https://gs1.org/voc/postalCode.title: Postal Code
https://gs1.org/voc/postalCode.description: Text specifying the postal code for an address.

https://gs1.org/voc/postOfficeBoxNumber.title: Post Office Box Number
https://gs1.org/voc/postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The number that identifies a PO box. A PO box is a box in a post office or other postal service location assigned to an organization where postal items may be kept.

schema.title: Postal Address
schema.description: The location at which a particular organization or person may be found or reached.

organizationName.title: Organization Name
organizationName.description: The name of the organization expressed in text.

streetAddress.title: Street Address
streetAddress.description: The street address expressed as free form text. The street address is printed on paper as the first lines below the name. For example, the name of the street and the number in the street or the name of a building.

addressLocality.title: Address Locality
addressLocality.description: Text specifying the name of the locality, for example a city.

addressRegion.title: Address Region
addressRegion.description: Text specifying a province or state in abbreviated format for example NJ.

addressCountry.title: Address Country
addressCountry.description: Code specifying the country (and country subdivision) for the address using ISO 3166-1.

crossStreet.title: Cross Street
crossStreet.description: A street intersecting a main street (usually at right angles) and continuing on both sides of it.

countyCode.title: County Code
countyCode.description: A code that identifies a county. A county is a territorial division in some countries, forming the chief unit of local administration. In the US, a county is a political and administrative division of a state.

postalCode.title: Postal Code
postalCode.description: Text specifying the postal code for an address.

postOfficeBoxNumber.title: Post Office Box Number
postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The number that identifies a PO box. A PO box is a box in a post office or other postal service location assigned to an organization where postal items may be kept.

https://schema.org/Substance.title: Substance
https://schema.org/Substance.description: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

https://www.gs1.org/voc/ingredientName.title: Ingredient Name
https://www.gs1.org/voc/ingredientName.description: Free text field describing an ingredient or ingredient group. Ingredients include any additives (colourings, preservatives, e-numbers, etc.) that are encompassed.

https://www.gs1.org/voc/ingredientConten.title: Ingredient Content Percentage
https://www.gs1.org/voc/ingredientConten.description: Quantity of the ingredient contained in the product as a percentage of the total product ingredients. This is used in conjunction with ingredientName.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/for.title: Formula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/for.description: A chemical formula is a way of presenting information about the chemical proportions of atoms that constitute a particular chemical compound or molecule, using chemical element symbols, numbers, and sometimes also other symbols, such as parentheses, dashes, brackets, commas and plus and minus signs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.title: InChI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.description: The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) is a textual identifier for chemical substances, designed to provide a standard way to encode molecular information and to facilitate the search for such information in databases and on the web.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.title: InChIKey
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.description: The condensed, 27 character InChIKey is a hashed version of the full InChI (using the SHA-256 algorithm), designed to allow for easy web searches of chemical compounds.

schema.title: Substance
schema.description: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

ingredientName.title: Ingredient Name
ingredientName.description: Free text field describing an ingredient or ingredient group. Ingredients include any additives (colourings, preservatives, e-numbers, etc.) that are encompassed.

ingredientContentPercentage.title: Ingredient Content Percentage
ingredientContentPercentage.description: Quantity of the ingredient contained in the product as a percentage of the total product ingredients. This is used in conjunction with ingredientName.

formula.title: Formula
formula.description: A chemical formula is a way of presenting information about the chemical proportions of atoms that constitute a particular chemical compound or molecule, using chemical element symbols, numbers, and sometimes also other symbols, such as parentheses, dashes, brackets, commas and plus and minus signs.

inchi.title: InChI
inchi.description: The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) is a textual identifier for chemical substances, designed to provide a standard way to encode molecular information and to facilitate the search for such information in databases and on the web.

inchikey.title: InChIKey
inchikey.description: The condensed, 27 character InChIKey is a hashed version of the full InChI (using the SHA-256 algorithm), designed to allow for easy web searches of chemical compounds.

https://schema.org/recipeIngredient.title: Recipe Ingredient
https://schema.org/recipeIngredient.description: A single ingredient used in the recipe.

recipeIngredient.title: Recipe Ingredient
recipeIngredient.description: A single ingredient used in the recipe.
